node.title: 'Inheriting my father's enemies': The pros and cons of having a famous parent
node.alt: The Downer family in matching blue shirts smile at a video camera.
node.description: Three people with famous parents open up about the opportunities and challenges that come with theÂ family name.
node.content:
["When Georgina Downer walked into a pub just outside of Adelaide in 2018, she was ready for the rough and tumble of a\u00a0campaign event.", "Ms Downer was running as the Liberal candidate in the Mayo by-election and thought she was across all the issues that mattered to her potential constituents.", "\"But the first question I got asked \u2026 was about the war crimes that Dad had committed in the Iraq War, and what was I going to do about them,\" she tells ABC RN's Sunday Extra.", "", "
Georgina Downer ran as the Liberal candidate for the South Australian seat of Mayo in 2018 and\u00a02019.(ABC News: Isabel Dayman)
", "Ms Downer is the daughter of Liberal heavyweight Alexander Downer, who held the South Australian seat of Mayo for 24 years and was foreign minister\u00a0in the Howard government for 11 years.", "For Ms Downer, having a famous (or infamous, according to some pub patrons) parent brings both opportunities and challenges, especially when trying to follow in their footsteps.", "
The CEO
", "Politics runs in Ms Downer's blood.", "Not only is she the daughter of a foreign minister, but also the granddaughter of an immigration minister and great-granddaughter of a South Australian premier.", "But she says people misunderstand what it means to come from a lineage like this.", "\"When you have a famous parent, they may have a brilliant, shining career, but there are a lot of very low moments that the family has to share,\" she says.", "Ms Downer inherited her father's passion for international affairs and worked around Asia and the Pacific for the Australian government, the International Republican Institute and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).", "", "
Alexander Downer served as Australia's foreign minister for 11 years.(Getty Images: Greg Wood)
", "But her father's shadow loomed large.", "\"Every time you succeed, you almost have to succeed twice as well as your parent, just to prove that you were able to do it yourself. There's always that criticism, 'oh you only got there because of your dad',\" she says.", "For some Australians, like the Mayo pub patrons, Mr Downer's legacy is forever tied to his support for the country's participation in the Iraq War.", "Ms Downer's tilt at\u00a0Mayo was unsuccessful at the 2018 by-election and again at the 2019 general election.", "She's now continuing the family's Liberal legacy\u00a0as the inaugural CEO of the Robert Menzies Institute at the University of Melbourne.", "But being the child of a prominent politician can sometimes\u00a0lead\u00a0to a far more troubled life.", "
The fall from grace
", "Andrew Hughes of the Australian National University's College of Business and Economics has researched the history of personal identities and personal brands.", "He says having a famous parent can be either a blessing or a curse.", "\"[For some people], it's good because you can achieve a lot more in life if you want to, because you've already got a head start. A name can carry a lot of weight in some areas of society and life,\" he says.", "\"But then the flip side is we see some of those people fall from grace.\"", "Dr Hughes points to Harriet Wran, daughter of the former NSW Premier Neville Wran, as someone who \"has had a lot of issues in her life and cites her father's fame and popularity as a reason for that.\"", "Ms Wran spent two years in jail for her role in the robbery and murder of a Sydney drug dealer and suffered from an addiction to crystal methamphetamine.", "\"There would have been a lot of pressure on her to live up to the standard of what her father was in public life.\"", "\"We see some people just can't carry through in the same way as their parent, as expected of them by society.\"", "
The mountaineer
", "Peter Hillary's father was not only the most famous person in his native New Zealand, but among the most famous in the world.", "Edmund Hillary and fellow mountaineer Tenzing Norgay were the first people confirmed to have reached the peak of Mount Everest in 1953.", "", "
A young Peter Hillary (centre) with\u00a0his father Edmund and the\u00a0family in London in 1962.(Getty Images: FPG)
", "Peter also decided to become a mountaineer and literally followed in his father's footsteps, reaching the summit of Everest twice.", "He's also completed the 'seven summits' \u2014 climbing the highest mountain on each of the seven continents \u2014 and trekked across Antarctica to the South Pole.", "But it took him many years to come to this conclusion.", "\"It seems to me, we're hardwired to see people as being in the shadow [of a parent],\" he says.", "\"And I've actually come to the conclusion, I'd rather see myself as being in the light of my father. There's amazing benefits and opportunities that have come through being the son of Ed Hillary.\"", "", "
Peter Hillary says it's been a journey over many years to find his place in the world.(Reuters:\u00a0Gopal Chitrakar)
", "In addition to being a successful mountaineer, Peter is also a writer and philanthropist, spending much of his time working with his father's humanitarian organisation the Himalayan Trust.", "\"It's been a journey \u2026 I don't know why it is that we feel we have to equal a parent or even surpass them,\" he says.", "It's something other children of famous people have struggled with.", "
The gallerist
", "Tim Olsen's dad was not like other dads.", "\"With his beret and his wonderfully eccentric attire \u2026 he certainly was a different father to the other fathers at my school,\" he says.", "", "
John Olsen and his son Tim Olsen at an exhibition in 2016.(ABC News: Margaret Burin)
", "Tim's father John Olsen is one of the country's most famous living artists, with a career spanning more than 60 years and\u00a0topped off with an Archibald Prize in 2005.", "Tim is a prominent gallerist and recently wrote a memoir titled \"Son of the Brush,\" where he unpacked his complex relationship with his famous father.", "\"Intellectually, I felt that I could never, ever be as accomplished as him \u2026 I turned him into a kind of demigod, and I was so overwhelmed, which put me into such a 'less than' kind of mentality,\" he says.", "\"I'll never forget someone once said to me, 'In 200 years time, they'll be talking about your father, but they won't be talking about you.' That just really knocked me sideways.\"", "After an upbringing immersed in the art world, Tim went on to work in and manage many leading Australian galleries.", "\"Nepotism can only get you so far. What people don't realise is actually I've had to work probably twice as hard because of the critical nature of our society.\"", "Tim points to his mother Valerie Strong as a grounding force, as she \"taught me the important values of humility, the power of silence and that sensitivity is strength.\"", "\"What's really important in life is to know thyself and never judge yourself by society \u2026 Find your own compass.\"", "
Mr Bradsen
", "Australian National University's Dr Hughes points out that many children of famous people try to separate themselves from the family name.", "The son of cricketing legend Sir Donald Bradman, for example, changed his famous last name from Bradman to Bradsen in 1972, until he reclaimed it in 2008.", "\"He wanted to get away from the fame, he had enough of it, he wanted people to see him as an equal,\" Dr Hughes says of John Bradman.", "At the end of the day, Dr Hughes says he's happy not coming from a famous lineage.", "\"We know that anything we achieve, we've done it ourselves. And that sense of achievement, I think, is very, very powerful.\""]
